Miscellaneous Highlights: Former Texas Rangers player Elvis Andrus retired after playing the first 12 seasons of his 15-year Major League career in Arlington.
Others: Elvis Andrus held a news conference to announce his retirement as an active Texas Rangers player.
Andrus signed a one-day contract with the Rangers during the news conference.
Elvis Andrus threw out the ceremonial first pitch before the baseball game between the Los Angeles Angels and Texas Rangers.
